prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
The witness Detective Gumshoe is explaining why the police believe Mask☆DeMasque, a known thief, is responsible for the theft of the Sacred Urn.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: Me. What more can I say? This is my third year as a young (but skilled!) lawyer.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Adrian Andrews
Description: Head of planning, promotion, and security of the Treasures of Kurain Exhibit.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Mask☆DeMasque
Description: A flashy thief who steals valuable works of art. Sends a calling card before a heist.
Character 7
Name: Luke Atmey
Description: An Ace Detective. Has great powers of deduction, yet rarely makes sense.
Character 8
Name: Ron DeLite
Description: A young man who turned himself in as Mask☆DeMasque. A bit of a pitiful guy.
Character 9
Name: Desirée DeLite
Description: Ron DeLite's wife. Seems to be a very friendly and out-going lady.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: My friend. I've known this trouble magnet ever since grade school.
Character 11
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 12
Name: Kane Bullard
Description: CEO of KB Security. His body was found inside his safe.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.
Evidence 2
Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. The Sacred Urn of Kurain Village will be displayed in Lordly Tailor.
Evidence 3
Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime. Carried into the basement warehouse the day of the crime. Moved again that night.
Evidence 4
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value. Found in the office of Luke Atmey. Has pink splotches all over it. Found in Atmey's Office. Covered in pink splotches, but it's the genuine article. Broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks ago, then replaced in its box. Kept out of sight.
Evidence 5
Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.
Evidence 9
Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.
Evidence 10
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. Click here to read. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.
Evidence 11
Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).
Evidence 12
Name: Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used. Found in Ron's wallet. Used on October 12th, the night of the crime, at 1 AM.
Evidence 13
Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask☆DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.
Evidence 15
Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.
Evidence 16
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask☆DeMasque's first heist. Click here for details. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.
Evidence 18
Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.
Evidence 20
Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.
Evidence 21
Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.
Evidence 22
Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Mask☆DeMasque is a master thief that first started his crime spree 6 months ago.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: He's so confident that he sends his calling card before he even commits the crime!
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: This was his fifth heist, and as usual, he sent a card on to Lordly Tailor.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: His pattern is to always go after only the most precious art pieces.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: That's why we're sure it was Mask☆DeMasque, sir. It fits his M. O. to a T!
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let me try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants one pair where the evidence contradicts a testimony. 

First, I'll look at the testimonies from Detective Gumshoe. He's the one giving the testimonies here. Let me go through each of his statements.

Testimony 0: Mask☆DeMasque started his crime spree 6 months ago. Testimony 1: He sends a calling card before the crime. Testimony 2: This is his fifth heist, and he sent a card to Lordly Tailor. Testimony 3: His pattern is to go after the most precious art pieces. Testimony 4: That's why they're sure it's him, fits his M.O.

Now, the evidence. Let's check each piece. The Sacred Urn (Evidence 4) is described as looking like a plain pot and has no monetary value. But according to Testimony 3, DeMasque targets the most precious art. The urn is priceless but not valuable in terms of money, and it's plain. So if the urn isn't a valuable or precious art piece, then DeMasque wouldn't target it, contradicting Testimony 3. 

Evidence 4 states the urn has no monetary value and looks plain. So the testimony that he goes after the most precious art (which the urn isn't) would contradict that. That's a possible pair: Evidence 4 contradicts Testimony 3.

Wait, let me check other possibilities. Evidence 2 is the Treasure Exhibit Poster, which mentions the Sacred Urn is displayed. Maybe that's relevant, but the contradiction is more about the urn's value. So Evidence 4 directly states the urn isn't valuable, which goes against Testimony 3. That seems solid. 

Another angle: The calling card (Evidence 5) is sent, which matches the testimonies about sending a card. But maybe the evidence about the urn's actual value contradicts the motive. So yes, the key contradiction is between Testimony 3 (steals precious art) and Evidence 4 (urn isn't valuable). That's the pair.

{"evidence": 4, "testimony": 3}

response:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. The question is asking which evidence and testimony from the given list contradict each other. So I need to go through each testimony and see if any of the evidences directly contradict what's being said.

Looking at the testimonies by Atmey:

Testimony 0 says the incident happened around 1 AM. Testimony 1 mentions Mask☆DeMasque arriving then. Testimony 2 describes being struck from behind while turning. Testimony 3 says he was knocked out and when he woke up, the thief was gone. Testimony 4 states he called police 30 minutes later.

Now, looking at the evidences. Let's check the Camera Data (Evidence 7) which says the warehouse camera went off around 1 AM. Then the Key Card (Evidence 12) was used at 1 AM on the night of the crime. The Buzzer Record (Evidence 19) shows the buzzer went off at 1:02 AM. The Sacred Urn (Evidence 4) was found in Atmey's office with pink splotches, and the Urn Box (Evidence 21) has pink paint stains. The Autopsy Report (Evidence 15) says Kane died at 1 AM from a head injury.

Wait, Testimony 4 says Atmey called police 30 minutes after the incident. If the incident was at 1 AM, then he called at 1:30. But the Buzzer Record (Evidence 19) shows the buzzer in the CEO's office went off at 1:02 AM. The CEO's death time is also 1 AM. So if Atmey was knocked out around 1 AM, how did the buzzer go off at 1:02? But Atmey claims he was unconscious until he woke up and then called the police 30 minutes later. Wait, but the CEO's death was at 1 AM. If Atmey was knocked out at 1 AM, but the buzzer went off at 1:02, maybe that's a contradiction because he couldn't have pressed the buzzer if he was already unconscious. Wait, but the CEO's office buzzer (Evidence 17) is connected to the basement. The Buzzer Record (19) says it went off at 1:02 AM. If Atmey was knocked out at 1 AM, he couldn't have pressed the buzzer at 1:02. But maybe the real killer did. Hmm. Alternatively, maybe the Key Card (Evidence 12) was used at 1 AM by Ron to enter the CEO's office. But Ron is the one who turned himself in as Mask☆DeMasque. Wait, but the Key Card was used at 1 AM, which is the same time as the camera data (Evidence 7) and the time of death. So perhaps the contradiction is between Atmey's Testimony 0 (incident at 1 AM) and the Buzzer Record (19) which is at 1:02 AM. But I'm not sure. Let me check again.

Atmey's Testimony 0 says the incident was at 1 AM. The Camera Data (7) shows the warehouse camera activated at around 1 AM. The Key Card (12) was used at 1 AM. The Autopsy Report (15) says death at 1 AM. So the murder and the theft happened around the same time. But Testimony 4 says Atmey called the police 30 minutes later. But if the Buzzer went off at 1:02, maybe that's after he was knocked out, which would mean someone else was there. But how does that contradict his testimony?

Alternatively, the Sacred Urn (Evidence 4) was found in Atmey's office. But Atmey's testimonies don't mention anything about the urn. However, the Sacred Urn was supposed to be in the exhibit. If he was knocked out and the thief left, how did the urn end up in his office? That might be a contradiction, but Atmey's testimony doesn't directly address the urn's location.

Wait, let's look at Testimony 3: When he awoke, the thief was gone. But the Sacred Urn was found in Atmey's office. So if the thief took it, why is it in Atmey's office? That could imply that Atmey might be involved, but how does that contradict his testimony?

Alternatively, the Camera Data (7) shows the warehouse camera went off at 1 AM. Testimony 0 says the incident was at 1 AM. But maybe the camera was triggered by movement, which would be the thief. However, if Atmey was there at 1 AM, maybe the camera caught something else. Wait, but the camera data is in the warehouse. Atmey's location during the incident isn't specified, but if the Sacred Urn was in his office, maybe he wasn't at the warehouse. Hmm, this is getting complicated.

Another angle: Testimony 2 says Atmey was struck on the head from behind as he began to turn. The Shichishito (Evidence 6) is a ceremonial sword that wasn't bent before the crime, and DeMasque used a blow to the back of Atmey's head. The Autopsy Report (15) says Kane died from a head injury. Maybe the same weapon was used, but that's more of a connection than a contradiction.

Wait, the Key Card (Evidence 12) was used at 1 AM to enter the CEO's office. If Ron's Key Card was used there at 1 AM, but Atmey was in another location (like the warehouse) at the same time, that might create a contradiction. But Atmey's testimony doesn't mention where he was. Alternatively, if the Key Card usage is at 1 AM, but Atmey claims to have been attacked at 1 AM, then Ron (using the key card) and the thief (attacking Atmey) would be in two places at once. But since Ron is the one who turned himself in as the thief, maybe there's a contradiction here. Wait, but Ron's Testimony (20) says that from the second heist, he was stealing under blackmail. So if Ron was at the CEO's office using the key card at 1 AM, he couldn't be attacking Atmey at the same time. Therefore, Atmey's Testimony 0 (incident at 1 AM) and Evidence 12 (Key Card used by Ron at 1 AM) might contradict, implying that the real thief was elsewhere. But since Ron is the confessed thief, this would suggest he couldn't be in two places at once. However, the problem is asking for a pair of evidence and testimony that directly contradict each other.

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 4: Atmey says he called the police 30 minutes later. If the incident was at 1 AM, he called at 1:30. But the Buzzer Record (19) shows the buzzer was pressed at 1:02 AM. If the buzzer was pressed after Atmey was knocked out, but he was unconscious, then he couldn't have pressed it. But the buzzer's record might indicate that someone else was in the CEO's office at 1:02, which would mean that Atmey's account of being unconscious from 1 AM until he woke up to call the police 30 minutes later is contradicted by the buzzer going off at 1:02. However, the buzzer is connected to the basement Security Guard Office. If Atmey was in a different location, maybe the buzzer being pressed by someone else isn't a direct contradiction. Hmm.

Wait, another angle: The Sacred Urn (Evidence 4) was found in Atmey's office with pink splotches, and the Urn Box (21) has pink paint stains. The Paint Marks (22) say that when Adrian dropped the urn's box two weeks ago, she knocked over paint. So the pink on the urn and box came from that incident. But the urn was supposed to be in its box, kept out of sight. However, the urn was found in Atmey's office. Atmey's testimony doesn't mention anything about moving the urn. If he was knocked out and the thief left, how did the urn end up in his office? That could imply that Atmey himself moved it, contradicting his testimony that the thief escaped. But this is more of an inconsistency than a direct contradiction.

Wait, perhaps the Camera Data (7) shows the warehouse camera went off at 1 AM, which would be around the time of the crime. But according to Atmey's testimony, the thief was there at 1 AM. If the camera was triggered, maybe the thief was caught on camera, but Atmey's description of the thief (Mask☆DeMasque) might not match the actual person in the camera. But there's a Security Camera Photo (Evidence 9) which is a photo of the storeroom entrance. If that photo shows someone else, that would contradict Atmey's testimony. But the user hasn't provided the photo details, so maybe we can't use that. Alternatively, the Camera Data (7) and Testimony 0 both mention 1 AM, so no contradiction there.

Wait, let's look at Testimony 2: Atmey says he was struck from behind as he began to turn. The Shichishito (Evidence 6) is a sword that wasn't bent before the crime, but DeMasque used it to knock Atmey out. If the sword wasn't bent before, but after the crime it was bent, that could support his testimony. But that's not a contradiction. Alternatively, the murder weapon for Kane was also a blow to the head (Autopsy 15), which could be the same weapon. But again, not a direct contradiction.

Wait, the Key Card (12) was used at 1 AM by Ron. If Ron was using the key card at 1 AM in the CEO's office, then he couldn't be the one attacking Atmey at the same time. But Atmey says Mask☆DeMasque attacked him. If Ron is DeMasque, then there's a contradiction because he can't be in two places at once. However, the problem requires a specific evidence-testimony pair. The Key Card (12) being used at 1 AM contradicts Testimony 0 (incident at 1 AM) if the Key Card use is in a different location. Therefore, the evidence that Ron was at the CEO's office at 1 AM (Evidence 12) contradicts Atmey's Testimony 0 that the thief was with him at 1 AM. Thus, the contradiction is between Evidence 12 and Testimony 0. But wait, Testimony 0 just says the time was approximately 1 AM, which is consistent with Evidence 12's time. But maybe the location is different. If Ron was using the key card at KB Security's office at 1 AM, he couldn't be in the warehouse or wherever Atmey was. Therefore, if Atmey claims to have encountered the thief at 1 AM, but the Key Card shows Ron was elsewhere, that's a contradiction. Since Ron is supposed to be Mask☆DeMasque, but he was at KB Security's office at the same time, Atmey's testimony of encountering the thief at that time is contradicted. So the pair would be Evidence 12 (Key Card used at 1 AM) and Testimony 0 (incident at 1 AM). But Testimony 0 is about the time, not the location. Hmm.

Alternatively, Testimony 4 says Atmey called police 30 minutes later. If the incident was at 1 AM, he called at 1:30. But the Buzzer Record (19) shows the buzzer was pressed at 1:02 AM. If the buzzer was pressed after Atmey was knocked out, that implies someone else was there, but Atmey didn't mention that. However, this might not directly contradict unless Atmey's testimony says he was alone. He doesn't mention others, but the buzzer could have been pressed by someone else. That's possible, but not a direct contradiction.

Another possibility: The Sacred Urn (Evidence 4) was found in Atmey's office, which contradicts his Testimony 3 that the thief was gone when he awoke. If the thief took the urn, it shouldn't be in Atmey's office. Therefore, the presence of the urn there suggests Atmey might have taken it, which contradicts his statement that the thief escaped with it. But the urn's description says it was found in his office, so that would imply the thief left it there, which contradicts the idea that the thief stole it. However, the Sacred Urn's description says it's "supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot" and "has no monetary value", so maybe the thief didn't want it. But if the thief's calling card was sent, perhaps they intended to steal it, but left it. That could be a contradiction. But how does this directly contradict a specific testimony?

Atmey's testimonies don't mention the urn specifically. He just says the thief attacked him and left. So if the urn was stolen and found in his office, that suggests he might have been involved, but it doesn't directly contradict his testimony unless he explicitly says the thief took it. Since he doesn't mention the urn, maybe that's not the contradiction.

Wait, the Urn Box (21) has pink paint stains, and the Sacred Urn (4) also has pink splotches. The Paint Marks (22) indicate that the paint was spilled two weeks ago when Adrian dropped the box. So the urn was in the box when the paint was spilled, hence both have pink stains. But the urn was supposed to be kept out of sight in its box. However, the urn was found in Atmey's office, outside of its box. If the box was in the warehouse or exhibit, and the urn was moved to Atmey's office, that suggests someone moved it. If Atmey's testimony says he was knocked out and the thief left, how did the urn get to his office? That suggests Atmey moved it himself, which contradicts his testimony. But again, he doesn't mention the urn, so this might not be a direct contradiction.

Hmm. Maybe I need to find a more direct contradiction. Let's think again. The Key Card (12) was used at 1 AM, which is the same time as the incident. If the Key Card was used by Ron to enter the CEO's office, then Ron (as the thief) couldn't be attacking Atmey at the same time. Wait, the CEO's office buzzer (Evidence 17) has no fingerprints. The Buzzer Record (19) shows it was pressed at 1:02 AM. If Atmey was unconscious from 1 AM until he called police at 1:30, then the 1:02 buzzer press was by someone else. But Atmey's testimony doesn't mention anyone else, so this could imply he's lying. However, without direct mention in his testimony, it's hard to say.

Let me check the Camera Data (7) again. The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM. If the theft happened there, and the Key Card was used at the CEO's office at 1 AM, that's two different locations. So if Ron used the Key Card at 1 AM, he wasn't at the warehouse, contradicting Atmey's claim that the thief was there. Therefore, Evidence 12 (Key Card used at 1 AM) contradicts Testimony 1 (thief arrived at 1 AM), since Ron couldn't be in two places. But Testimony 1 says the thief arrived at 1 AM, which is the same time Ron was using the Key Card. Hence, this would be a contradiction. Therefore, the pair is Evidence 12 and Testimony 1. But let me double-check.

Evidence 12: Key Card used on October 12th, the night of the crime, at 1 AM. Testimony 1: Atmey says Mask☆DeMasque arrived at 1 AM. If Ron is Mask☆DeMasque and was using the Key Card at 1 AM, he couldn't have been at the warehouse (assuming the locations are different). Therefore, the evidence and testimony contradict each other because Ron/DeMasque was in two places at once. So the answer should be {"evidence": 12, "testimony": 1}.

But wait, the Key Card is for the KB Security CEO's office. If the theft was happening in the warehouse (as per the Camera Data 7), and Ron was at the CEO's office, then he couldn't be in both places. Therefore, Atmey's testimony that DeMasque was at the warehouse at 1 AM is contradicted by Evidence 12 showing Ron was elsewhere. Hence, this is the contradiction.

{"evidence": 12, "testimony": 1}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other here. So, the user provided a list of characters, evidence, and testimonies, and we need to find a pair where the evidence contradicts a testimony.

First, let me go through the testimonies given by Luke Atmey (Testimony 0 to 5). He's the witness talking about his encounter with the thief. 

Looking at Testimony 2: "Unfortunately, the thief grabbed a weapon from the side and... rendered me senseless." So Atmey claims that the thief used a weapon from the side to knock him out.

Now, checking the evidence. Evidence 6 is the Shichishito, a ceremonial sword from the statue. The description says that DeMasque knocked Atmey out with a blow to the back of the head. Also, the Shichishito wasn't bent before the crime. 

Wait, if Atmey says the thief grabbed a weapon from the side to hit him, but the evidence (Shichishito) was used to hit him from the back of the head. That's a contradiction. Because the direction of the blow (from the side vs. back) would differ. So Testimony 2 says the weapon came from the side, but the evidence (Shichishito's use) implies it was a blow to the back of the head. That's a direct contradiction. 

Another possible point: Testimony 5 says Atmey put his back to the wall and the blow landed on his third eye (forehead area?), but the autopsy report (if related) says cause was a blow to the head. But the key contradiction here is between the direction of the attack as per testimony versus the evidence stating where the blow landed. 

But focusing on the weapon and the direction, Evidence 6 directly states the blow was to the back of the head, which contradicts Testimony 2 where the thief grabbed a weapon from the side. So the evidence 6 (Shichishito) contradicts Testimony 2.

{"evidence": 6, "testimony": 2}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. The user wants me to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. They specified only one pair, so I need to look through the testimonies and evidences provided.

First, the testimonies from Ron (Testimonies 0-5). He claims to be Mask☆DeMasque and that he was at the Lordly Tailor shop during the crime. Let's check each testimony against the evidence.

Testimony 3 says Ron donned his costume and went to the scene of the crime that night. The scene here would be Lordly Tailor, where the Sacred Urn was displayed (Evidence 2). But looking at Evidence 12, the Key Card found in Ron's wallet was used at 1 AM on the night of the crime at KB Security's CEO office. The CEO's office is where the Sacred Urn was found (Evidence 4 says it was in Atmey's office, but wait, no—Evidence 4 mentions the Sacred Urn was found in Luke Atmey's office. Wait, the KB Security CEO's office is where the key card was used. So, if Ron used the key card at 1 AM at KB Security's CEO office (Evidence 12), which is the crime scene where Kane Bullard's body was found (Character 12), then Ron was there at 1 AM. But the Lordly Tailor shop is "decently far away" from other locations. So, if Ron was at KB Security's office at 1 AM using the key card (Evidence 12), he couldn't have been at Lordly Tailor at the same time. His Testimony 3 claims he was at the scene (Lordly Tailor), but Evidence 12 places him elsewhere. Therefore, Testimony 3 contradicts Evidence 12.

Wait, but the Sacred Urn was stolen from Lordly Tailor? The Treasure Exhibit Poster (Evidence 2) says the Sacred Urn was displayed at Lordly Tailor. However, Evidence 4 says the Sacred Urn was found in Atmey's office. So the theft was from Lordly Tailor, but the urn ended up in Atmey's office. But Ron's alibi for the night of the theft is that he was at Lordly Tailor. However, Evidence 12's Key Card usage at 1 AM at KB Security's CEO office (which is where the body was found) would mean he was there, not at Lordly Tailor. Since Lordly Tailor is far away, he can't be in both places at once. Therefore, Testimony 3 (being at Lordly Tailor) contradicts Evidence 12 (key card used at KB Security office at 1 AM). The time of death for Kane Bullard is 1 AM (Evidence 15), so Ron was at the CEO office at that time. So he couldn't have been at Lordly Tailor committing the theft there. Therefore, the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (he was at Lordly Tailor) and Evidence 12 (he was at KB Security office at 1 AM).

{"evidence": 12, "testimony": 3}
